meanings.definition: A person or thing that pins.
meanings.sent1: The pinners at the sewing club were skilled at making beautiful quilts.
meanings.sent2: I need more pinners to hang up all these pictures on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought it was a good idea to play with the pinners from the sewing kit.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like sharp pinners, pricking at his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The pinners in the bulletin board held up important reminders for everyone to see.

meanings.definition: A small piece of wood or metal used to fasten or secure something.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used pinners to attach the pieces of wood together.
meanings.sent2: I found some rusty pinners in the old toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorns under the pinners in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a cascade of pinners, holding their friendship together.
meanings.sent5: The pinners in the door kept it firmly closed against the strong wind outside.

meanings.definition: A type of marijuana cigarette rolled with a thin paper.
meanings.sent1: He rolled a couple of pinners to relax after a long day.
meanings.sent2: The group passed around some pinners at the party.
meanings.sent3: The pinners in the movie made the characters act silly and hungry.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams floated like fragrant pinners in the air, calming her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sweet smell of pinners lingered in the room long after they were smoked.
